tweets.text: A community in Staffordshire are living with doors & windows taped up.Nose bleeds, breathing issues, toxic fumes from the landfill site @WalleysL run by @RedIndustries2  The @EnvAgency have found the company  'in breach' but v little action #socialjustice  https://t.co/DehURqq0oi

The air in my house is thick with landfill fumes tonight. Again. There‚Äôs nowhere to hide from it. You cannot expect us to keep living like this @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe #WalleysQuarry #StopTheStink

tweets.text: Today we're testing the Hebden Bridge #flood warning siren, between 2pm and 3pm. The siren sounds like a traditional air raid siren and may be sounded a few times during the testing. The siren should be treated seriously if sounded at any other time. https://t.co/vKRWj6qHmb https://t.co/biOV7YjcJp

@Samanth33412592 @poppers82 @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe I don't know what is worse when it's constantly smelling or when we get that all important break from the smell. Either way the anxiety it's starting cause is unreal. I've never wanted more or escape as much as I do now üòî

We're in #Airmyn, nr #Goole this week doing ground investigations to help us design work to stabilise and strengthen a river bank on the River Aire. The work will better protect and reduce #flood risk to 171 homes, the school, pub and businesses in Airmyn. #FCERM https://t.co/EIqAvmuokL

#StopTheStink Again last night check on my kids & the stench & H2S gasses floods from there room Constant exposure of H2S to our eldest Ben can lead to further damage to his already existing brain damage with CP. tweets.text:
It‚Äôs #InvasiveSpecies week!
Invasive non-native species reduce the ability of native wildlife to cope with other pressures such as climate change & habitat loss. 
This week we‚Äôll be sharing content about invasive non-native species &what you can do to help 
#INNSweek @InvasiveSp https://t.co/UPv86RxO35

Floating pennywort is an invasive plant that costs the economy at least ¬£25 million a year.

To tackle this, we have teamed up with @AnglingTrust, @BritishCanoeing and an army of local volunteers, to leave floating pennywort with nowhere to hide. 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/NCESUYazJc https://t.co/YpvN7pBbbo

tweets.text: @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids About time! We want hear about actions though, not words and more delay.

@EmmaJHope64 @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgencySE Hi @EmmaJHope64 - we are aware that our Lower Test Nature Reserve is currently experiencing high levels of diesel pollution. We are working hard to resolve this issue and have contacted the relevant authorities, including the Environment Agency.
@Laura_James88 @RedIndustries2 @WalleysL @EnvAgency @Tus_M_ @Sotlive Has only just come to my attention... What a shocker.

@RicHolden @nwater_care Have @HownsgillEnergy considered the reservoir when planning their waste incinerator @nwater_care @EnvAgency ? @plumeplotter could the emissions travel as far as the #DerwentResevoir ?

@JuliaBradbury @RedIndustries2 @WalleysL @EnvAgency @Tus_M_ Hi Julia,
Yes my colleagues at @Sotlive have written - and continue to write - a significant amount of stories regarding the issues around Walleys Quarry.
